easy.answer: OOP (Object Oriented Programming) in Java organizes code into objects using principles like Encapsulation, Inheritance, Polymorphism, and Abstraction.
A Java class is a blueprint for creating objects, containing fields and methods.
JVM (Java Virtual Machine) runs Java bytecode and provides platform independence.

medium.answer: Overloading occurs within the same class with different parameter lists. Overriding happens in a subclass with same method signature.

medium.q: What is the difference between abstract class and interface?
medium.answer: Abstract classes can have implemented methods; interfaces cannot (until default methods). A class can extend one abstract class but implement multiple interfaces.
Multithreading allows concurrent execution of multiple threads to maximize CPU utilization in Java.

hard.answer: JMM defines how threads interact through memory, covering heap, stack, visibility, and atomicity rules.
GC marks reachable objects, sweeps unused ones, compacts heap, and releases memory.
Class loaders load Java classes at runtime: Bootstrap, Extension, System, and Custom class loaders.

easy.answer: Python is an interpreted, high-level, dynamically typed programming language.
A list is a mutable ordered collection of items in Python.
Basic types include int, float, str, list, tuple, dict, set, bool.

medium.answer: Lists are mutable; tuples are immutable. Tuples are faster and safer for constants.
Decorators wrap a function to extend its behavior without modifying its code.
A concise syntax to create lists using a single expression.

hard.answer: The Global Interpreter Lock allows only one thread to execute Python bytecode at a time.
Metaclasses define how classes behave; they are classes of classes.
Python uses reference counting and a cyclic garbage collector to free unused objects.

easy.answer: An array is a contiguous collection of elements of the same type.
A linked list is a linear structure where each node contains data and a reference to the next node.
Stack uses LIFO. Queue uses FIFO.

medium.answer: Merge sort divides the list into halves recursively and merges sorted halves. O(n log n).
A BST stores nodes such that left < root < right for efficient search.
Hashing maps keys to indices in constant time using a hash function.

hard.answer: Dijkstra finds the shortest path from a source to all nodes in a weighted graph.
DP solves problems by storing results of overlapping subproblems.
Detecting cycles in graphs using DFS or Union-Find.
